data.name: IntroWhoAreWe
data.value: eWorky is the portal to workspaces

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text1
data.value: Tomorrow’s workspace will be human-centric more than company-based and will be an interactive space suitable for exchange and collaboration: a place where we’re happy to be at work.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text10
data.value: If you think like us, come join us!

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text2
data.value: In order to collectively reinvent tomorrow’s workplace, it’s necessary to explore, to test, to discuss and above all jump right in.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text3
data.value: The advent of new ways of working is an opportunity to establish a new social norm in which autonomy overtakes subordination, creativity overtakes obedience and responsibility overtakes controlled hierarchy.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text4
data.value: The opening to others, sharing and collaboration are essential to personal development and to a comfortable workspace.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text5
data.value: Workers need social experiences and human exchange during their day. Our work lives need to be more open, replacing constraints with cooperatives and co-creation in building collectivities of virtual work.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text6
data.value: The workplace is no longer standalone, but rather collaborative, at times even non-physical et more adapted to specific tasks, a sector or to the worker’s personality.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text7
data.value: Sustainable development is a priority… not tomorrow, but today. For this reason, our new workspaces and work habits must inherently take into account respect for our planet and environment.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text8
data.value: The world is changing at an accelerating pace fueled by new technologies and faster exchanges of information.

data.name: WeThinkThat_Text9
data.value: In rethinking the workspace thanks largely to the idea of co-working spaces and shared workspaces, we can transform daily work life, our interaction with others and the world. The workspace must not only be a platform for change, but also the impulse behind change.

data.name: WhoAreWe_Text1
data.value: eWorky was created in 2011 by 3 young entrepreneurs in response to a simple need: the ability to access a wifi connection and renting a meeting room for precise times and in different cities. The idea of a collaborative search platform for workspaces, thus rapidly took off.

data.name: WhoAreWe_Text2
data.value: eWorky is thus the enjoyment of all types of shared workspaces and an exchange of experiences in these workspaces. Our community is made up of passionate users willing to discover or propose a diverse set of workspaces adapted to specific needs.

data.name: WhoAreWe_Text3
data.value: Now it’s your turn. Join the eWorky community now!

data.name: Team_Member_1_Text
data.value: Living in Paris, Olivier is responsible for eWorky’s strategy and storyboarding. In addition to being discrete in his open space interactions as well as a fish vendor on Saturday mornings at 5am in Rungis market, Olivier is a big fan of walking and is a hardcore vegetarian. But above all, Olivier emphasizes pure design and is dedicated to removing unnecessary buttons and spelling mistakes.

data.name: Team_Member_2_Text
data.value: Cécilia is in charge of business development, PR, and finance for eWorky. She works from Grenoble and watch out, because she won’t deal with negative comments about her mountainous region! Optimistic, hyperactive and a big fan of full schedules and tight deadlines, she is implicated heavily in promoting digital culture and entrepreneurship as co-president of notably, the Young Entrepreneurs Circle (CJE). When she finds the time, she likes strolling around in her street shoes, rock climbing and horseback riding.

data.name: Team_Member_3_Text
data.value: Tahir is THE development specialist, so much so that it can sometimes be hard to understand everything he’s talking about. An avid reader of Dostoïevski and Camus, he is also comfortable with programming as immersing himself in coffee, cake and all types of chocolate bars. Originally from Ulis (like Thierry Henry), he has already worked with poultry, been scuba diving and a drive to correct spelling mistakes is as evident as the empty packs of cookies behind him compensates the zeal with which Olivier makes corrections.

data.name: Team_Member_4_Text
data.value: Marc is the head of Business Development for Spanish-speaking countries. He is based in Saragossa, Spain, and enjoys the lifestyle and extraordinary density of tapas bars the city has to offer. Marc is like the country where he settled down: friendly and passionate about good food, sport, and fiesta. We still haven’t figured out what drug he is on to bring so much energy to the team. But we suspect a secret mix of Cacique, olive oil and chorizo.
